name: Pickthall
text: Ha. Mim.

name: Pickthall
text: By the Scripture which maketh plain,

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! We have appointed it a Lecture, in Arabic that haply ye may understand.

name: Pickthall
text: And Lo! in the Source of Decrees, which We possess, it is indeed sublime, decisive.

name: Pickthall
text: Shall We utterly ignore you because ye are a wanton folk?

name: Pickthall
text: How many a prophet did We send among the men of old!

name: Pickthall
text: And never came there unto them a prophet but they used to mock him.

name: Pickthall
text: Then We destroyed men mightier than these in prowess; and the example of the men of old hath gone (before them).

name: Pickthall
text: And if thou (Muhammad) ask them: Who created the heavens and the earth, they will surely answer: The Mighty, the Knower created them;

name: Pickthall
text: Who made the earth a resting-place for you, and placed roads for you therein, that haply ye may find your way;

name: Pickthall
text: And Who sendeth down water from the sky in (due) measure, and We revive a dead land therewith. Even so will ye be brought forth;

name: Pickthall
text: He Who created all the pairs, and appointed for you ships and cattle whereupon ye ride.

name: Pickthall
text: That ye may mount upon their backs, and may remember your Lord's favour when ye mount thereon, and may say: Glorified be He Who hath subdued these unto us, and we were not capable (of subduing them);

name: Pickthall
text: And lo! unto our Lord we surely are returning.

name: Pickthall
text: And they allot to Him a portion of His bondmen! Lo! man is verily a mere ingrate.

name: Pickthall
text: Or chooseth He daughters of all that He hath created, and honoureth He you with sons?

name: Pickthall
text: And if one of them hath tidings of that which he likeneth to the Beneficent One, his countenance becometh black and he is full of inward rage.

name: Pickthall
text: (Liken they then to Allah) that which is bred up in outward show, and in dispute cannot make itself plain?

name: Pickthall
text: And they make the angels, who are the slaves of the Beneficent, females. Did they witness their creation? Their testimony will be recorded and they will be questioned.

name: Pickthall
text: And they say: If the Beneficent One had (so) willed, we should not have worshipped them. They have no knowledge whatsoever of that. They do but guess.

name: Pickthall
text: Or have We given them any scripture before (this Qur'an) so that they are holding fast thereto?

name: Pickthall
text: Nay, for they say only: Lo! we found our fathers following a religion, and we are guided by their footprints.

name: Pickthall
text: And even so We sent not a warner before thee (Muhammad) into any township but its luxurious ones said: Lo! we found our fathers following a religion, and we are following their footprints.

name: Pickthall
text: (And the warner) said: What! Even though I bring you better guidance than that ye found your fathers following? They answered: Lo! in what ye bring we are disbelievers.

name: Pickthall
text: So We requited them. Then see the nature of the consequence for the rejecters!

name: Pickthall
text: And when Abraham said unto his father and his folk: Lo! I am innocent of what ye worship

name: Pickthall
text: Save Him Who did create me, for He will surely guide me.

name: Pickthall
text: And he made it a word enduring among his seed, that haply they might return.

name: Pickthall
text: Nay, but I let these and their fathers enjoy life (only) till there should come unto them the Truth and a messenger making plain.

name: Pickthall
text: And now that the Truth hath come unto them they say: This is mere magic, and lo! we are disbelievers therein.

name: Pickthall
text: And they say: If only this Qur'an had been revealed to some great man of the two towns?

name: Pickthall
text: Is it they who apportion thy Lord's mercy? We have apportioned among them their livelihood in the life of the world, and raised some of them above others in rank that some of them may take labour from others; and the mercy of thy Lord is better than (the wealth) that they amass.

name: Pickthall
text: And were it not that mankind would have become one community, We might well have appointed, for those who disbelieve in the Beneficent, roofs of silver for their houses and stairs (of silver) whereby to mount,

name: Pickthall
text: And for their houses doors (of silver) and couches of silver whereon to recline,

name: Pickthall
text: And ornaments of gold. Yet all that would have been but a provision of the life of the world. And the Hereafter with your Lord would have been for those who keep from evil.

name: Pickthall
text: And he whose sight is dim to the remembrance of the Beneficent, We assign unto him a devil who becometh his comrade;

name: Pickthall
text: And lo! they surely turn them from the way of Allah, and yet they deem that they are rightly guided;

name: Pickthall
text: Till, when he cometh unto Us, he saith (unto his comrade): Ah, would that between me and thee there were the distance of the two horizons - an evil comrade!

name: Pickthall
text: And it profiteth you not this day, because ye did wrong, that ye will be sharers in the doom.

name: Pickthall
text: Canst thou (Muhammad) make the deaf to hear, or canst thou guide the blind or him who is in error manifest?

name: Pickthall
text: And if We take thee away, We surely shall take vengeance on them,

name: Pickthall
text: Or (if) We show thee that wherewith We threaten them; for lo! We have complete command of them.

name: Pickthall
text: So hold thou fast to that which is inspired in thee. Lo! thou art on a right path.

name: Pickthall
text: And lo! it is in truth a Reminder for thee and for thy folk; and ye will be questioned.

name: Pickthall
text: And ask those of Our messengers whom We sent before thee: Did We ever appoint gods to be worshipped beside the Beneficent?

name: Pickthall
text: And verily We sent Moses with Our revelations unto Pharaoh and his chiefs, and he said: I am a messenger of the Lord of the Worlds.

name: Pickthall
text: But when he brought them Our tokens, behold! they laughed at them.

name: Pickthall
text: And every token that We showed them was greater than its sister (token), and We grasped them with the torment, that haply they might turn again.

name: Pickthall
text: And they said: O wizard! Entreat thy Lord for us by the pact that He hath made with thee. Lo! we verily will walk aright.

name: Pickthall
text: But when We eased them of the torment, behold! they broke their word.

name: Pickthall
text: And Pharaoh caused a proclamation to be made among his people saying: O my people! Is not mine the sovereignty of Egypt and these rivers flowing under me? Can ye not then discern?

name: Pickthall
text: I am surely better than this fellow, who is despicable and can hardly make (his meaning) plain!

name: Pickthall
text: Why, then, have armlets of gold not been set upon him, or angels sent along with him?

name: Pickthall
text: Thus he persuaded his people to make light (of Moses), and they obeyed him. Lo! they were a wanton folk.

name: Pickthall
text: So, when they angered Us, We punished them and drowned them every one.

name: Pickthall
text: And We made them a thing past, and an example for those after (them).

name: Pickthall
text: And when the son of Mary is quoted as an example, behold! the folk laugh out,

name: Pickthall
text: And say: Are our gods better, or is he? They raise not the objection save for argument. Nay! but they are a contentious folk.

name: Pickthall
text: He is nothing but a slave on whom We bestowed favour, and We made him a pattern for the Children of Israel.

name: Pickthall
text: And had We willed We could have set among you angels to be viceroys in the earth.

name: Pickthall
text: And lo! verily there is knowledge of the Hour. So doubt ye not concerning it, but follow Me. This is the right path.

name: Pickthall
text: And let not Satan turn you aside. Lo! he is an open enemy for you.

name: Pickthall
text: When Jesus came with clear proofs (of Allah's Sovereignty), he said: I have come unto you with wisdom, and to make plain some of that concerning which ye differ. So keep your duty to Allah, and obey me.

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! Allah, He is my Lord and your Lord. So worship Him. This is a right path.

name: Pickthall
text: But the factions among them differed. Then woe unto those who do wrong from the doom of a painful day.

name: Pickthall
text: Await they aught save the Hour, that it shall come upon them suddenly, when they know not?

name: Pickthall
text: Friends on that day will be foes one to another, save those who kept their duty (to Allah).

name: Pickthall
text: O My slaves! For you there is no fear this day, nor is it ye who grieve;

name: Pickthall
text: (Ye) who believed Our revelations and were self-surrendered,

name: Pickthall
text: Enter the Garden, ye and your wives, to be made glad.

name: Pickthall
text: Therein are brought round for them trays of gold and goblets, and therein is all that souls desire and eyes find sweet. And ye are immortal therein.

name: Pickthall
text: This is the Garden which ye are made to inherit because of what ye used to do.

name: Pickthall
text: Therein for you is fruit in plenty whence to eat.

name: Pickthall
text: Lo! the guilty are immortal in hell's torment.

name: Pickthall
text: It is not relaxed for them, and they despair therein.

name: Pickthall
text: We wronged them not, but they it was who did the wrong.

name: Pickthall
text: And they cry: O master! Let thy Lord make an end of us. He saith: Lo! here ye must remain.

name: Pickthall
text: We verily brought the Truth unto you, but ye were, most of you, averse to the Truth.

name: Pickthall
text: Or do they determine any thing (against the Prophet)? Lo! We (also) are determining.

name: Pickthall
text: Or deem they that We cannot hear their secret thoughts and private confidences? Nay, but Our envoys, present with them, do record.

name: Pickthall
text: Say (O Muhammad): If the Beneficent One hath a son, then, I shall be first among the worshippers. (But there is no son).

name: Pickthall
text: Glorified be the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Lord of the Throne, from that which they ascribe (unto Him)!

name: Pickthall
text: So let them flounder (in their talk) and play until they meet the Day which they are promised.

name: Pickthall
text: And He it is Who in the heaven is Allah, and in the earth Allah. He is the Wise, the Knower.

name: Pickthall
text: And blessed be He unto Whom belongeth the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, and with Whom is knowledge of the Hour, and unto Whom ye will be returned.

name: Pickthall
text: And those unto whom they cry instead of Him possess no power of intercession, saving him who beareth witness unto the Truth knowingly.

name: Pickthall
text: And if thou ask them who created them, they will surely say: Allah. How then are they turned away?

name: Pickthall
text: And he saith: O my Lord! Lo! these are a folk who believe not.

name: Pickthall
text: Then bear with them (O Muhammad) and say: Peace. But they will come to know.
